function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Interactions with humans may be detrimental to animals, causing stress responses and changes in population size and distribution.","Impact":"Negative impact on animal well-being and population sustainability.","Mitigation":"Design and management of green spaces to decrease disturbance levels and provide refuge for animals.","Technologies":"Environmental monitoring systems, wildlife-friendly design principles.","People":"Wildlife in urban environments.","Owner":"Urban planners, wildlife conservation organizations."},{"Description":"Indicators of green space quality are influenced by outcomes in bird assemblages, leading to potential bias in wildlife outcome assessments.","Impact":"Misinterpretation of green space quality and its impact on wildlife due to biased indicators.","Mitigation":"Inclusion of measures that assess qualitative aspects of community composition, addressing less studied animal groups, and using standard metrics for comparison.","Technologies":"Biodiversity assessment tools, wildlife monitoring technologies.","People":"Wildlife conservation researchers, urban planners.","Owner":"Research institutions, environmental agencies."},{"Description":"Inclusion of measures that assess qualitative aspects of community composition is important to distinguish between urban exploiters, alien and invasive species, and native and sensitive species in green spaces.","Impact":"Unbalanced representation of species richness and abundance due to the dominance of urban exploiters and invasive species.","Mitigation":"Use of measures such as the urbanity index to differentiate habitat requirements for different species and the design of heterogeneous networks of green spaces.","Technologies":"Species identification tools, ecological monitoring devices.","People":"Wildlife conservation researchers, urban planners.","Owner":"Environmental agencies, conservation organizations."}]}
